This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier."},"renounceOwnership()":{"details":"Leaves the contract without owner. acceptOwnership().details: The new owner accepts the ownership transfer.

anchorV2(uint64,bytes32,uint32,(uint8,ui.details: The gas limit for this transaction must be set to 250,000 gas.This function can be called freely as the golden touch private key is publicly known, but the Taiko node guarantees the first transaction of each block is always this anchor transaction, and any subsequent calls will revert with L2_PUBLIC_INPUT_HASH_MISMATCH.

params._anchorBlockId: The `anchorBlockId` value in this block's metadata.
params._anchorStateRoot: The state root for the L1 block with id equals `_anchorBlockId`.
params._parentGasUsed: The gas used in the parent block.

anchorV3(uint64,bytes32,uint32,(uint8,ui.details: The gas limit for this transaction must be set to 1,000,000 gas.This function can be called freely as the golden touch private key is publicly known, but the Taiko node guarantees the first transaction of each block is always this anchor transaction, and any subsequent calls will revert with L2_PUBLIC_INPUT_HASH_MISMATCH.

params._anchorBlockId: The `anchorBlockId` value in this block's metadata.
params._anchorStateRoot: The state root for the L1 block with id equals `_anchorBlockId`.
params._parentGasUsed: The gas used in the parent block.
params._signalSlots: The signal slots to mark as received.

params._baseFeeConfig: Configuration parameters for base fee calculation.
params._parentGasUsed: Gas used in the parent block.

returns.basefee_: The calculated EIP-1559 base fee per gas.

params.blockId: The ID of the block whose hash is being requested.

returns._0: _ The block hash of the specified block ID, or 0 if no hash is found.

params._l1ChainId: The ID of the base layer.
params._owner: The owner of this contract. msg.sender will be used if this value is zero.

returns._0: True if the contract is operating on L1, false if on L2.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

pendingOwner().details: Returns the address of the pending owner.

proxiableUUID().details: Implementation of the ERC1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

returns._0: Returns true to skip checking basefee mismatch.

transferOwnership(address).details: Starts the ownership transfer of the contract to a new account. Replaces the pending transfer if there is one. Can only be called by the current owner.

upgradeTo(address).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

params._token: Token address or address(0) if Ether.

GOLDEN_TOUCH_ADDRESS().notice: Golden touch address is the only address that can do the anchor transaction.

anchorV2(uint64,bytes32,uint32,(uint8,ui.notice: Anchors the latest L1 block details to L2 for cross-layer message verification.

anchorV3(uint64,bytes32,uint32,(uint8,ui.notice: Anchors the latest L1 block details to L2 for cross-layer message verification.

getBasefeeV2(uint32,uint64,(uint8,uint8,.notice: Calculates the base fee and gas excess using EIP-1559 configuration for the given parameters.

getBlockHash(uint256).notice: Retrieves the block hash for a given block ID.

isOnL1().notice: Determines the operational layer of the contract, whether it is on Layer 1 (L1) or Layer 2 (L2).

lastSyncedBlock().notice: The last synced L1 block height.

parentGasExcess().notice: The gas excess value used to calculate the base fee.

parentGasTarget().notice: The last L2 block's gas target.

paused().notice: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

publicInputHash().notice: A hash to check the integrity of public inputs.

resolver().notice: Returns the address of this contract.

skipFeeCheck().notice: Tells if we need to validate basefee (for simulation).

withdraw(address,address).notice: Withdraw token or Ether from this address. Note: This contract receives a portion of L2 base fees, while the remainder is directed to L2 block's coinbase address.

documentation.text: @notice Golden touch address is the only address that can do the anchor transaction.

@notice Mapping from L2 block numbers to their block hashes. All L2 block hashes will
 be saved in this mapping.

@notice A hash to check the integrity of public inputs.
 @dev Slot 2.

@notice The gas excess value used to calculate the base fee.
 @dev Slot 3.
@notice The last synced L1 block height.
@notice The last L2 block's timestamp.
@notice The last L2 block's gas target.
@notice The L1's chain ID.
@inheritdoc IBlockHashProvider

@notice Tells if we need to validate basefee (for simulation).
 @return Returns true to skip checking basefee mismatch.

statements.documentation:
@dev If the anchor block ID is less than or equal to the last synced block, return
 early.

@dev Store the L1's state root as a signal to the local signal service to
 allow for multi-hop bridging.
@dev Update the last synced block to the current anchor block ID.

documentation.text:
@dev Updates the parent block hash and timestamp.
 @param _parentId The ID of the parent block.

@dev Verifies the current ancestor block hash and updates it with a new aggregated hash.
 @param _parentId The ID of the parent block.
